title: Install Catppuccin tmux plugin via TPM
description: Run TPM install to fetch catppuccin/tmux plugin. Verify it lands in the plugins directory.

title: Fix display mapping: screen_id does not match SketchyBar display number
description: Root cause of both visual bugs. Rift screen_id=3 maps to SketchyBar display 1 (main monitor), screen_id=1 maps to display 3 (laptop), but code uses display=screen_id directly. Need runtime probe: create temp items per SketchyBar display, query bounding_rects for global coordinates, match to Rift display frame origins via closest-distance, build screen_id→sketchybar_display mapping.
close_reason: Fixed via display probe: create temp items per SketchyBar display, query bounding_rects for global coords, match to Rift frame origins. Verified all 3 displays now have correct workspace items.

title: Add Catppuccin tmux plugin with custom theme colors
Refactor SketchyBar spaces.lua for Rift WM
description: Create items/spaces_rift.lua that integrates SketchyBar with Rift window manager instead of AeroSpace. Preserve original spaces.lua. Update init.lua to load the new module.
close_reason: Implemented spaces_rift.lua with per-display workspaces, jq-based JSON parsing, event subscriptions, and click-to-switch. Verified working with sketchybar --reload.

title: Tmux theme integration
description: Add tmux theming support integrated with the theme-set system. Includes powerline-style status bar with session/prefix indicator (left), window tabs (center), and git branch + directory (right).

title: Re-symlink active theme and reload tmux
description: Run theme-set for the current theme to re-symlink the updated tmux.conf, then reload tmux config to verify the Catppuccin rounded status line renders correctly with theme colors.
close_reason: Theme symlink verified (osaka-jade), tmux config reloaded successfully

title: Update tmux.conf for Catppuccin plugin load order
description: Add catppuccin/tmux TPM plugin, set layout options (rounded style) before TPM load, set status-left/right modules after TPM load. Maintain correct ordering: theme colors → layout options → TPM → status modules.

title: Add tmux to theme-set script
description:
Add tmux section to themes/.local/bin/theme-set:
- Symlink themes/configs/<theme>/tmux.conf to ~/.config/tmux/theme.conf
- Hot-reload via 'tmux source-file' if tmux is running
- Add is_installed check for tmux

title: Workspace items appear on wrong monitor bar
description: Ghostty on ws 2 and Helium on ws 1 of main monitor show in laptop's SketchyBar bar. Caused by screen_id→display mapping bug. Depends on display mapping fix.
close_reason: Fixed via display probe: create temp items per SketchyBar display, query bounding_rects for global coords, match to Rift frame origins. Verified all 3 displays now have correct workspace items.

title: Create base tmux.conf with powerline layout
description:
Update tmux/.config/tmux/tmux.conf with:
- Powerline status bar layout (left|center|right)
- Left: session name + prefix indicator
- Center: window tabs (index+name, accent bg for active)
- Right: source for git/directory display
- Angled separators (▶ ◀)
- Source theme.conf for colors
- True color support

title: Create tmux theme configs for all themes
description:
Create themes/configs/<theme>/tmux.conf for:
- osaka-jade
- tokyo-night
- gruvbox
- everforest

Each should set:
- status-style (bg1 background, fg text)
- window-status colors (bg2 inactive, accent active)
- pane-border colors
- message colors
Using colors from themes.json

title: Update all 4 theme tmux.conf files with @thm_* color overrides
description: Map each theme's 6 colors (bg0/bg1/bg2/fg/accent/grey) to all 26 @thm_* variables. Themes: osaka-jade, tokyo-night, gruvbox, everforest. Set variables BEFORE plugin loads so -o flag respects them.

title: Create git branch helper script for tmux
description:
Create a helper script that tmux can call to get:
- Current git branch name (or empty if not in repo)
- Abbreviated current directory path
Place in themes/.local/bin/ or tmux/.config/tmux/scripts/

title: Install and configure Rift tiling WM
description: Install Rift via Homebrew, create stow package with config translated from AeroSpace keybindings, stow it, and prepare for testing
close_reason: Rift installed via Homebrew, stow package created with translated AeroSpace keybindings, config symlinked to ~/.config/rift/config.toml
